column5: You would think this would be a simple google search but nooooo! Do children under 18 need a passport or just their birth certificate?
Google "taking children into canada"several pages of info
Here's a link with the info you need.http://www.ehow.com/how_5883440_chil...an-border.html

And don't forget that if both parents are not accompanying the minor that the absent parent or parents should provide a letter authorizing the minor to travel to Canada. This is especially true if the parents are divorced. And list the telephone number of the nontravelling parent in the letter.

I had my wife sign the letter in front of a notary public. Never had anyone look at it on the way into Canada but they did coming back to the U.S. I don't know about the passport. Laws have changed since my son went along.

It makes things easier if he has one, The letter from your spouse is a must, having dates,destination and contact information will speed up your crossing. Children are taken very seriously at the border, especially when there is only 1parent present.

Get the passport. Passports are more of a U.S. requirement for returning than they are a Canadian requirement for entering and techically are not needed if under 16 and an original birth certificate or other proof of citizenship is available. In the unlikely event that a medical flight back to the US is necessary, the lack of a passport for the minor could cause a delay.
